autoAppliedRules.name: user/custom
autoAppliedRules.content:
be concise unless i specifically request more detail.  don't be destructive unless i specifically request you to be.  you don't need to summarize or repeat what you did unless i specifically request you to. always strive for consistency in methods and means and visuals.

before making any major changes, you must review the ARCHITECTURE_DESIGN.md file to remind yourself of what our architecture is supposed to be.

any new frontend pages or elements must conform to our visual standards and any icon must from from our standard icon set.  do not create pages or elements that do not conform to our common visual standards.

content.text: I can see the issue - it looks like you have a massive number of deleted files that haven't been committed yet. This is likely from a restructuring or cleanup operation. Let me check what's in the rebuild directory:

I can see you have a `rebuild` directory with your new system architecture. It looks like you've restructured your project but haven't committed the changes yet. Let me check your Git remote configuration:
Let me check if you have any authentication issues:

Your Git configuration looks correct. The main issue seems to be that you have a lot of uncommitted changes. What specifically is "fucked up" about your GitHub? Are you:

1. Unable to push changes?
2. Getting authentication errors?
3. Having merge conflicts?
4. Something else?

Let me try a simple test to see if you can connect to GitHub:
can you just fucking commit everything and get rid of all of the files that are supposed to be deleted on github?
can you just fucking commit everything and get rid of all of the files that are supposed to be deleted on github?
I'll commit all the changes and push them to clean up your GitHub repository.
